title: Lesson 01 - The Foundation
summary: Build safe habits, correct grip, ready position, and forward lunge mechanics.
goals: Master the correct forehand grip (shake-hands grip).
Learn forward lunge mechanics to prevent injury.

structure.title: Introduction & Warm-up (15 min)
items: Safety briefing: non-marking shoes, check slippery spots, avoid collisions.
Joint mobilization: neck tilts and turns (skip full rotations), shoulder rolls, wrist rotations, hip circles, knee rotations, ankle rolls.

structure.title: Fundamental Technique: Grip & Stance (25 min)
items: Forehand grip: hold the racket shaft with the non-racket hand, shake hands with the handle, V-shape between thumb and index finger.
Checkpoints: feel the bevels, leave a gap between palm and handle.
Ready position: feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, racket up in front, weight on the balls of the feet.

structure.title: Ball Confidence & Coordination (20 min)
items: Shuttle taps to keep the shuttle in the air at eye level.
Pick up the shuttle from the floor with the racket.
Simple underhand feed and gentle lift over the net.

structure.title: Footwork Basics: The Lunge (20 min)
items: Step forward with the racket leg.
Heel lands first, then roll to toe.
Front heel stays flat to load the glute.
Non-racket foot drags lightly as a brake.

structure.title: Fun Game: Bucket Challenge (10 min)
items: Place a box or bucket on the service line.
Serve or toss underhand to land the shuttle in the bucket.

structure.title: Cool-down & Debrief (10 min)
items: Recap: grip quality affects everything else.
Homework: practice switching to the shake-hands grip.

drills.name: Shuttle taps
notes: Keep the shuttle at eye level.

coachingNotes: Reinforce the V-shape grip and the gap between palm and handle.
Keep the ready position relaxed but alert.
Front heel stays flat to protect the knee and load the glute.
safety: Wear non-marking shoes and check for slippery spots.
Skip full neck rotations during warm-up.
